Pre-Game Insights: Entering this fixture, both teams suffered massive defeats.
The Netherlands were on the receiving end of a 309-run loss against Australia.
Bangladesh were defeated by South Africa with a 149-run margin in Mumbai.
The Eden Gardens in Kolkata is known to produce great batting tracks with an average score of 256.
Fast bowlers can generate some swing in the second innings while spinners can also come into play as the wicket slows down and starts gripping.
The Netherlands’ batting has been a massive letdown, with players like Vikramjit Singh, Max O’Dowd, and Teja Nidamanuru failing to score a lot of runs.
Bangladesh has a similar record of one win out of five games and would want to get back to winning ways in Kolkata.
Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan has travelled back to Bangladesh in order to train with his mentor.
